bug.author: niallomahony93
bug.summary: TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for +: 'NoneType' and 'str' when running dashboard.ipynb
bug.description:
I get the following error when running dasboard.ipynb in jupyter lab
TypeError Traceback (most recent call last) in 1 selector_model_name = pn.widgets.Select(name='Model name', options=experiment_manager.model_name_wviz) ----> 2 selector_paths = pn.widgets.Select(name='Available runs', options=experiment_manager.get_model_wviz_paths(selector_model_name.value)) 3 selector_epoch = pn.widgets.Select(name='Epoch',options = experiment_manager.from_paths_to_epoch(selector_paths.value)) 4 selector_split = pn.widgets.Select(name='Split',options = experiment_manager.from_epoch_to_split(selector_epoch.value)) 5 selector_file = pn.widgets.Select(name='Sample',options = experiment_manager.from_split_to_file(selector_split.value)) /ichec/work/iecom001b/torch-points3d/torch_points3d/visualization/experiment_manager.py in get_model_wviz_paths(self, model_path) 170 171 def get_model_wviz_paths(self, model_path): --> 172 model_name = model_path + ".pt" 173 self._current_exps = self._experiment_with_viz[model_name] 174 return self._current_exps TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for +: 'NoneType' and 'str'
All modules imported successfully. model_path seems to stay as it was initialized: 'None', should that be the case?

comments.comment: That's not correct no... We haven't been using those in a while. Have you run the following command before running the notebook? <denchmark-code>jupyter labextension install @pyviz/jupyterlab_pyviz </denchmark-code>

Yes, I ran that command before running the notebook. It seems to be because I have nothing in the viz folder for the one run that I have from training votenet for object detection on scannet. How do I generate the visualizations for this?

Yes, I ran that command before running the notebook. It seems to be because I have nothing in the viz folder for the one run that I have from training votenet for object detection on scannet. How do I generate the visualizations for this?
Iâ€˜ve got the same problem, did u get any hint to solve this problem?

Ok, makes sense now. The visualisation dashboard is only working for a few specific models on segmentation tasks (I think pointnet++ and maybe kpconv). If you want to visualise the output I would suggest that you implement a notebook from scratch and save the output after each epoch. You can take a look at what we did for PointGroup:
And the notebook: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nicolas-chaulet/torch-points3d/blob/master/notebooks/pointgroup_debug.ipynb>https://github.com/nicolas-chaulet/torch-points3d/blob/master/notebooks/pointgroup_debug.ipynb</denchmark-link>
You can probably also reuse this notebook to explore the visuals: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nicolas-chaulet/torch-points3d/blob/master/notebooks/scannet_object_explorer.ipynb>https://github.com/nicolas-chaulet/torch-points3d/blob/master/notebooks/scannet_object_explorer.ipynb</denchmark-link>
Does that help?
Yes, that's helpful. It will probably be a while before I get to that stage with my own custom model but it looks to be clear what needs to be done for creating custom visualizations, Thanks.
